forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South wind around 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. South southeast wind 7 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, this afternoon brings a curious interplay of sun and clouds, where hints of brightness weave through the mottled sky. Though temperatures hover around a cool 59 degrees, a gentle south wind adds a chill that can be felt as the day progresses. The forecast calls for an increasing likelihood of rain, with a 40% chance leading into the evening. As the hours dwindle, those clouds will deepen, setting a stage for a much stronger 90% chance of rain tonight, making it wise to keep umbrellas handy as the city prepares for the impending downpour.

Currently, visibility appears somewhat hazy, with a potential marine layer lingering in the distance, obscuring the defined outlines of the Golden Gate. While not particularly unpleasant at this moment, the air carries a palpable sense of moisture, urging a choice of attire that balances comfort against the chill; layers are essential, perhaps a light jacket paired with a scarf to fend off the day’s breeze. As afternoon transitions into dusk, a stroll along a quieter neighborhood street or visiting a cozy café for a warm drink complements the weather beautifully. The dancing light of the fading sun through those clouds could even inspire a brief pause to take in the moment, before the rain takes center stage and evening settles in.
